instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.P3V3S0_EN: What is P3V3S0_EN? This signal enables the PP3V3_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
threads.message: Now board has the liquid damaged ,first when I get it have green ,orange on charger and start fan very loud ,no chime ,then I found that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> missing ,on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> was only 0.054V, first thing was to remove <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> ,try put the new one nothing no power ,no fan spin  ,try soldered <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> few times I was guessing bad connection because i had <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>P3V3S0_EN</SIGNAL> ,now will start only if I remove <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> with same symptoms from beginning  very loud fan and no brain ,so if I put back <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> nothing ,dead ,and I measure in diode mode <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> and its not shorted

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
threads.message: That is normal, I bet the power cycle works normal and the whole board is power cycling. Check all rails for shorts. Then check all the usual corrosion points, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and termination resistors and traces to <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, J6100.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
threads.message: Try everything new <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> ,re-soldered <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> dont see any corrosion ,put 3v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> cant found any hot component,still without <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> fan spin ,loosing mind

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
[SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
threads.message: The board without <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> turn on ,fan spin but have only 0.54v on cpu vcore, when put back <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> no spin missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> ,how you mean power cycling,when turn stay on ,no restarting or cycling

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
threads.message: <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> needs to be on there. Power cycling will be very short pulses on all rails. Best to measure with a scope as many multimeter will be too slow to catch the pulses especially auto ranging ones.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
threads.message: I remove bios chip and check <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> and its cycling freom 0.05 to 2.5 v ,what should i look

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
threads.message: All the stuff I already told you. <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and traces to it and the termination resistors (16 of them).

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
threads.message: Sorry termination resistors on which rail ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
threads.message: Search schematic for "termination" They go from data lines of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> to CPU and SMC. Traces or resistors are suspect.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) Power issue on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> or something else :-))
threads.message: Hi man finally working ,the problem was Jtag connector thx
